definition: unhappy/in low spirits/(of a knife) not sharp
to have to pour out what's on one's mind (idiom)

sentences.english: The dampness is unpleasant , not to mention the cold .
sentences.chinese: 潮湿就令人不快，更不必说寒冷了。

sentences.english: Selfishness and unhappiness often go hard in hand.
sentences.chinese: 自私和不快常是连在一起的。

sentences.english: Laws should distinguish materials that are offensive but not demonstrably harmful.
sentences.chinese: 法律应区分令人不快但并不明显有害的材料。

sentences.english: Order a coke with a meal only if determined to upset the waiter.
sentences.chinese: 除非你想令侍应生不快，否则点餐时别配以可乐。

sentences.english: This decision is likely to upset a lot of people.
sentences.chinese: 这项决定很可能会使很多人悻然不快。

sentences.english: Some workers remain unhappy with a settlement offered by the Japanese firm.
sentences.chinese: 一些工人仍然对日本公司提供的解决办法感到不快。

sentences.english: Her assertiveness turns off some traditionalists.
sentences.chinese: 她的自信让一些传统主义者感到不快。

sentences.english: I am a slow walker, but I never walk back.
sentences.chinese: 我走的不快，但绝不走回头路。

sentences.english: Only on hearing this did he change his mind. This unpleasant event made me quite unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 这次大煞风景的导游，令我颇为不快。

sentences.english: Tan Xiang scolded Chen Xiang fast, sit to smoke in the office.
sentences.chinese: 谭香的数落让陈响不快，坐在办公室抽烟。

sentences.english: If we don't hurry up the store will have been closing before we get there.
sentences.chinese: 咱们如不快一些儿，等我们到了那儿，店门就会关了。

sentences.english: Don't know why HuiZhen curator of the position of the induction of proud fast.
sentences.chinese: 不晓得缘由的惠珍对馆长高傲的立场感应不快。

sentences.english: They were pround, conceited fellows, and they very soon began to try to make Columbus uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 他们全是傲慢自大的人，很快就使哥伦布感到不快。

sentences.english: The bottom line is that attempting to prepare CW agents is likely to have unpleasant consequences.
sentences.chinese: 试图制备化学战剂起码可能造成令人不快的后果。

sentences.english: A miserable job, Lunette Ray Ban, about, has some accepted ancestry.
sentences.chinese: 然而，“让人不快”的工作有一些独特特点。

sentences.english: Do you remember, dear Aylmer, about the dream you had last night about this hateful mark?
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的，你还记得昨晚你梦到那块令人不快的痣吗？

definition: not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
hidden smile/smirk/to rejoice covertly/secret satisfaction concerning one's evil plans
